summary: James Lerer Wolf was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from at least December 1976 to January 1979. Payroll records detail his appointments, salary adjustments, and title changes within the committee. He appears in multiple payroll certifications and certification reports, indicating his consistent employment during the committee's investigation. The documents list his name alongside other committee staff, their positions, and salaries for various accounting periods.
significance: James Lerer Wolf's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. While the specific nature of his role isn't detailed in the provided summaries, his presence in payroll records and certification reports confirms his involvement in the committee's operations during a crucial period of its investigation.
